doc.title: PEP-FOLD

div.p: PEP-FOLD is a service for the de novo prediction of peptide conformation from amino acid sequence. It is based on a Hidden Markov Model derived Structural Alphabet that describes the conformation of a polypeptidic chain as a series of local overlapping canonical conformations of fragments of 4 amino acids. PEP-FOLD 4 comes with a new version of the force-field relying on the general Mie formulation of non bonded interactions. PEP-FOLD4 also includes for the first time a term modeling pH, ionic strength dependence, and extremity blocking.

ol.li: More concise format for results, including one multimodel pdb file for the 5 best models, and fragment trajectory only for the others.
Facilities to perform off-web additional calculations, including preparing simulation for batches of up to 10 sequences at a time. (Docker image)

div.div: Note: PEP-FOLD4, while improved, still does not presently manage disulfide bonds as efficiently as PEP-FOLD2. Please use former PEP-FOLD server to this goal. We remind that for a number of disulfide bond larger than 2, PEP-FOLD shows limited performance.

doc.authors: Rey J, Murail S, de Vries S, Derreumaux P, Tuff√©ry P.
doc.reference: PEP-FOLD4: A pH-dependent force field for peptide structure prediction in aqueous solution. Nucleic Acids Res., 2023.

div.label: Fill the service form with preset data
div.div: Note: PEP-FOLD4 will load a pre-configured test case. Click the "Reset" button above to reset the form.

Use this input field to specify the amino acid sequence of the peptide. The FASTA format.s preferred Example:
>tau_fragment
DNIKHVPGGGSVQIVYK
However a raw format is also accepted:
DNIKHVPGGGSVQIVYK
For more information about the format, please read the sequence format tutorial (Mobyle Tutorials section, on the left).
Note: Simulated sequence length must be comprised between 5 and 50 amino-acids.
Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1dep_A for chain A of the 1dep entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.

div.label:
Run label?
This label will correspond to the first field of the file names of the run, available for download.

Generator?
fbt ts3 ts4 ts5
Generator in use for the runs.
Usually, the forward backtrack (fbt) is rather good, but taboo-sampling (ts3, ts4, ts5) can be a better option for peptides in interaction. ts5 should only be used for peptide sizes longer than 20 amino acids, and ts4 is not recommanded below 12 amino acids.

Number of models?
100 200
Number of independent simulations to be run.
Usually, 100 is enough to get a good idea of peptide candidate conformations. In some cases however, generating 200 models can lead to improvement.

Monte Carlo steps?
30000 0
The number of Monte Carlo steps. 30 000 is the default. Setting it to 0 will invalidate the Monte Carlo procedure, and return un-refined models.

Monte Carlo temperature?
370 700
The Monte Carlo temperature. 370K was found effective with PEP-FOLD4. 700K can be considered to force larger sampling during the Monte Carlo.

Pseudo-random seed?
The pseudo random generator seed. PEP-FOLD is reproducible using the same seed with the same set of parameters. Negative values will trigger the use of a random seed value.

div.div: Entering the probabilities from a previous run with the same sequence will avoid redundant calculation of the probabilities and speed up the calculations. Warning: do not try to input irrelevant values as it will results in spurious models.

div.label:
Use Debye-Huckel contribution?
No Yes
Trigger the use of Debye-Huckel contribution.

Solvent pH?
2 2.5 3 3.5 4 4.5 5. 5.5 6. 6.5 7. 7.5 8. 8.5 9. 9.5 10. 10.5 11. 11.5 12. 12.5 13
The pH at which the simulation is run (only effective if Debye-Huckel in use).

Ionic strength (mM)?
1 10 20 50 100 150 200 300 500 1000
The value of the ionic strenght assimilated to NaCl concentration (mM).

Block extremities?
None Both Nter Cter
Trigger the neutralization of extremities (None means Nter and Cter are charged).

fieldset.legend: Non standard pKa values for specific residues (ONE per line)?

div.div:
The pKa values must be specified ONE per line. Each line on the form: index pKa, where index is the position of the residue in the sequence (from 1).
Example: 2 5.3

xhtml:div.xhtml:div:
Use this input field to specify the amino acid sequence of the peptide. The FASTA format.s preferred Example:
>tau_fragment
DNIKHVPGGGSVQIVYK
However a raw format is also accepted:
DNIKHVPGGGSVQIVYK
For more information about the format, please read the sequence format tutorial (Mobyle Tutorials section, on the left).
Note: Simulated sequence length must be comprised between 5 and 50 amino-acids.
Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1dep_A for chain A of the 1dep entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.
This label will correspond to the first field of the file names of the run, available for download.
Generator in use for the runs.

Usually, the forward backtrack (fbt) is rather good, but taboo-sampling (ts3, ts4, ts5) can be a better option for peptides in interaction. ts5 should only be used for peptide sizes longer than 20 amino acids, and ts4 is not recommanded below 12 amino acids.
Number of independent simulations to be run.
Usually, 100 is enough to get a good idea of peptide candidate conformations. In some cases however, generating 200 models can lead to improvement.
The number of Monte Carlo steps. 30 000 is the default. Setting it to 0 will invalidate the Monte Carlo procedure, and return un-refined models.
The Monte Carlo temperature. 370K was found effective with PEP-FOLD4. 700K can be considered to force larger sampling during the Monte Carlo.
The pseudo random generator seed. PEP-FOLD is reproducible using the same seed with the same set of parameters. Negative values will trigger the use of a random seed value.

Entering the probabilities from a previous run with the same sequence will avoid redundant calculation of the probabilities and speed up the calculations. Warning: do not try to input irrelevant values as it will results in spurious models.
Trigger the use of Debye-Huckel contribution.
Trigger the use of Debye-Huckel contribution.
The pH at which the simulation is run (only effective if Debye-Huckel in use).
The value of the ionic strenght assimilated to NaCl concentration (mM).
Trigger the neutralization of extremities (None means Nter and Cter are charged).

The pKa values must be specified ONE per line. Each line on the form: index pKa, where index is the position of the residue in the sequence (from 1).
Example: 2 5.3

The visualization is based on top of the NGL Viewer (https://nglviewer.org/). Being JavaScript / WebGL based, the behavior still depends on the browser (but remains largely better than with JAVA based visualizers).
Cluster centroids are the models similar to other models of the cluster with the lowest sOPEP energy value.
The 5 best models in one file (They correspond to the centroids of up to the 5 best clusters - see the clustering report)
Cluster 1 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 2 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 3 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 4 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 5 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)

Structural alphabet (SA) prediction profile. The probabilities, at each position of the sequence, of the 27 SA letters are sorted from helical (red), coil (blue) to extended (green).
Note: SA letters are 4 residue length, so the profile is of the size of the amino acid sequence minus 3.

Structural alphabet (SA) prediction probabilities. The probabilities, at each position of the sequence, of the 27 SA letters. You can save this file and input it for later runs on the same sequence, which will save calculation time.
Note: SA letters are 4 residue length, so the profile is of the size of the amino acid sequence minus 3.

jobState.name: https://mobyle2.rpbs.univ-paris-diderot.fr/data/services/servers/local/programs/PEP-FOLD4.xml
jobState.commandLine: pep-fold4.py --maxSimSze 50 --maxSeqSze 50 --noMQA --sortKey sOPEP -s iSeq.data -l PEPFOLD --generator fbt --nRuns 100 --mcSteps 30000 --mcT 370 --seed 1 --use_DH --wDH 1. --pH 3 --ionic_strength 1 --neutral_ext Both
